name: Courtyard by Marriott Portland Downtown/Convention Center

reviews.text: Easy to get to from the I-5 as its near the Convention Centre. Its in the Free Zone for the train into downtown (5 minutes). 2 blocks to Lloyd Centre mall though not the best shopping - try downtown or even better at Washington Square mall in south Portland. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast good deal at hotel ($6.95 continental included coffee and juice or $9.95 if you want eggs etc). $12 to park is a bit much.
reviews.title: Good Location and Value

likes.liked: — convenient location and friend, helpful staff

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Courtyard Marriott, Lloyd Center. Upon arrival, the desk staff was very helpful. After checking in, they said not to hesitate to ask questions about directions, recommendations downtown, etc. They also offered a complimentary shuttle anywhere downtown, which we took advantage on one night when we attended an event downtown. When we were dropped off, we were given the drivers business card and told to call him when we were ready to come home. The return call was promptly answered and we got great service with the shuttle.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The room we stayed in was very clean. I base cleanliness on several things but one especially is how clean the tub and shower curtain liner is. I have to give them huge thumbs up on cleanliness. The sheets were soft and plush, very comfy. The housekeeping staff were attentive and returned in stages (complying to our schedule) to complete housekeeping tasks in the room. One puzzlement, however, was an added local phone call charge on our bill. In this day of cell phone we had never once picked up the room telephone. The called number was listed on our bill and we did a reverse phone search on the Internet to see that the call made from our phone was a local cell phone. So, we came to the possible conclusion that one of the housekeepers may have made a call. The desk promptly removed the phone charge with no question. Just watch your bill carefully!
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, and inexpensive

likes.disliked: — Location wasn't great, but MAX Light Rail is a bonus: nearest stop at the Convention Center down the road

reviews.text: The rooms have free Ethernet access (not wi-fi) . There is a business room where you can print out boarding passes.
reviews.title: Value for Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is $12 per night. I personally think this should be complimentary. The garage is huge and there were only a few cars parked.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

likes.liked: — Short drive or MAX ride to everything
likes.disliked: — Parking may be a problem if busy. Garage is very tight.

reviews.text: Lobby is nice but the rooms are verging on trashy. You definitely get a slight feeling of seediness from the hotel rooms. It's an odd mix of nice things mixed with a seedy feeling. The lobby and restaurant is nice, the breakfast is GREAT, but the rest of the place is low class. The bed sheets were not soft but rather itchy. The "King" size bed was somehow smaller than a true king. There was NO fridge!! This caused us an excess of trouble as we couldn't have fresh snacks in our room or even cold water bottles. The tap water was undrinkable and the coke/water machine in hallway didn't work so obtaining drinking water was a real hassle!
reviews.title: Didn't Like It

likes.disliked: — the seedy feeling from the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had gross old windows with white stains blocking view and just an underlying appearance of cheapness. The 6th floor is extremely hot in summer so the hallways are stifling. Luckily the room A/C works well enough to combat the heat. The bedside phone was not working. The swimming pool is in a white room with so few windows that you feel like you are locked up in prison while swimming. The pool is surrounded by tile flooring that is extremely slippery. We witnessed two different kids fall down and they could have been badly injured had they not been so lucky.
reviews.title: Another Wonderful Marriott Experience

reviews.text: This place would be fine if one needed an inexpensive, clean, safe place to sleep for a night. But if looking for a pleasing place to be on a pleasure trip this is not it. For a vacation worthy spot inside of Portland you'll have to spend more or go to Jantzen Beach or somewhere else further from downtown. Parking is expensive ($12) but probably is like that anywhere in city center or downtown Portland.
reviews.title: Good location, good value

reviews.text: We reserved our weekend getaway package through Travelocity Last-Minute Deals and were originally booked into the Red Lion Convention Center. Boy what a craphole that place was -- and it was under construction -- a fact they failed to share at the time of our booking. After getting rude attitude from the front desk clerk, we left and got on the phone with Travelocity. About 10 minutes later we drove over to the Marriott to check things out. We were pleasantly surprised at the clean pool and fitness center, the attractive lounge and lobby, and the friendliness of the front desk staff. We gave them the okay to transfer us to the Marriott, and there was no upcharge, even though the Marriott is far superior to the seedy Red Lion. The front desk clerk graciously allowed us an early check in and handed us $20 in food vouchers for our inconvenience -- inconvenience that had nothing to do with Marriott. The room was very nice with comfortable beds and clean bathroom; the view too was better than we had anticipated. We were within walking distance of Red Robin, Wendy's, the Lloyd Center (mall) and even a funky part of town where we had a delicious Italian dinner (at the Pastini Pastaria). The next day as we were beginning to get ready for the graduation, we discovered the water had been shut off. Calamity! So we called down to discover they'd experienced a leak and had to do an emergency shut off. Although it was inconvenient at best, it was not anyone's fault, and the manager quickly had the shuttle driver drop us off at the nearby Marirott Residence Inn to take showers. We experienced hardly any delay at all and made it back in plenty of time to get our clothes on and make it to the commencement ceremony smelling and looking good. When we returned, the manager gave us $30 more in vouchers, which we later used in the lounge. Next time I'll book with a Marriott property and will pass up the Red Lion.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used marriott rewards points for my three night stay, so of course I felt like I was getting a great value at this hotel. The room was very clean, the staff was very helpful in orientating me to Portland with public transportation information especially, they gave me free laundry detergent (and the laundry facilities were spotless), and it was easy to get to the light rail system from the hotel.
reviews.title: Good price & location but parking limited

likes.liked: — It was pretty standard overall but I guess it'd be the location.
likes.disliked: — Parking, no in-room refrigerator and tiny pool.

reviews.title: What an amazing stay
reviews.text: Wonderful rooms and staff, everyone was attentive and friendly as can be. My kids loved the pool and spa. Parking was a bit of a challenge, but the staff was helpful when we had problems finding a space. Very good food in the restaurant, great selections. The bar staff was amazing...numerous infused drinks and knowledgeable bartenders that were extremely helpful in getting us out and about in Portland. This place is a must stay!!!!

Good location, easy to get to, and the staff was pleasant. But it's one of those older buildings with the really noisy air conditioning units that you expect to find in a cheap motel on the highway. Despite most aspects of the room being very acceptable, the noisy air conditioner, combined with problems flushing the toilet, made this a hotel I won't return to.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: I stayed here in mid-July for a week while attending a conference at the Oregon Convention Center, which is a very easy three block walk south of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good news, bad news
fantastic staff
reviews.text: I'm a frequent Courtyard customer and this one stood towards the middle, bottom-third of the ones I've used. It is in an urban setting, so the parking charge was no surprise (and its mentioned right off by the front desk) but the rest of the services were no better than spotty.

There's the typical Courtyard buffet breakfast (inc. 'made to order' omelettes) which was relatively well done (if somewhat haphazard in sevice). I was surprised to see the restaurant was also open for lunch and dinner but it appears to be a case of "the best the microwave can offer" at 3* restaurant prices. Skip it, and walk 3 blocks east to Stanford's for an excellent meal.
reviews.title: Late night downtown noise & shabby furniture disappointing
Nice spot
reviews.text: Nice, spacious room. Everything was very clean and daily maid service was excellent. Guest service was fanatastic and friendly. I got an insane $44 per night rate through Hotwire. Admittedly, I went during the last three days of '04 when the hotel was practically empty (no convention bizness, etc.). Nevertheless, I'd imagine things would go just as smoothly with a full house. Overall, a very good hotel experience. This was my second Courtyard by Marriott stay. I had another in Denver -- also very good.

reviews.title: Parking is worth the price
reviews.text: I stay at this hotel every month and took exception to the last entry: They charge $9.00 per night for parking, advertise it EVERYWHERE (including the Marriott website), and there is NO free parking anywhere in the Lloyd District. In fact, their competitor charges $18 per night! It's all parking meters or pay lots, including the streets around the hotel.

reviews.title: hidden parking charges
reviews.text: The staff is smart, warm and efficient and I've never felt unsafe anywhere in Portland... it's a very friendly city.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay in August 04
reviews.text: When I checked into this hotel, the room rate was confirmed by the clerk and I was given a parking pass for the underground garage. Upon checking out, I found out I was charged $8/day for parking. It was taken off my bill after complaining to the front desk, but it was very irritating not to be told about such a steep parking charge for a hotel NOT actually downtown, but in a residential neighborhood where I could have parked on the street. The manager should be reprimanded for not instructing the staff to tell people there is an $8/day parking charge.

Otherwise, hotel is nothing special. Whirlpool was cold and area around it dirty looking. Lobby was nice, rooms nothing special. LOUD street noise from my room on the 3rd floor that kept me awake at night.
reviews.title: Nice proximity to conference center

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Portland Downtown/Lloyd Hotel
